skill.name: peer-review
skill.description: Systematic peer review toolkit. Evaluate methodology, statistics, design, reproducibility, ethics, figure integrity, reporting standards, for manuscript and grant review across disciplines.
skill.summary: Systematic peer review toolkit. Evaluate methodology, statistics, design, reproducibility, ethics, f...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No credential access, environment harvesting, or network exfiltration patterns detected. Content is instructional and aligned with peer review tasks.

content.user_title: Strengthen manuscripts with structured peer review
content.value_statement: Manuscript reviews can miss key methodological and reporting flaws. This skill guides a systematic critique with clear stages and checklists.
actual_capabilities: Guide staged peer review from initial summary to detailed sections
Check statistical rigor, design controls, and reproducibility
Assess reporting guideline compliance using common standards
Evaluate figure clarity and data integrity risks
Provide structured report formats for major and minor comments
limitations: Does not access or verify external datasets or repositories
Cannot compute statistical tests or validate numeric results
Depends on user provided manuscript text or images
Does not replace domain specific expert judgment

use_cases.title: Speed structured reviews
use_cases.description: Use guided stages to cover methods, results, and ethics in a consistent review report.

use_cases.title: Assess proposal rigor
use_cases.description: Check design, feasibility, and reporting gaps before scoring a grant application.

use_cases.title: Train junior reviewers
use_cases.description: Provide checklists and examples to teach systematic peer review practices.

prompt_templates.title: Quick manuscript scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this abstract and conclusion. Provide a 2 sentence summary and three major concerns if any.

prompt_templates.title: Methods rigor check
prompt_templates.prompt: Assess methods for reproducibility, controls, and statistical appropriateness. List major and minor issues separately.

prompt_templates.title: Reporting guideline audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Identify which reporting guideline applies and list missing required elements based on the provided methods and results.

prompt_templates.title: Full peer review report
prompt_templates.prompt: Produce a full peer review with summary, major comments, minor comments, and questions for authors.

output_examples.input: Review this study for major issues and reporting gaps.
output: Summary: Clear hypothesis with novel data but limited validation.
Major: No power calculation or randomization details.
Major: Key control group is missing.
Minor: Figure legends lack sample sizes.

best_practices: Provide evidence based critiques with specific locations
Separate major validity issues from minor clarity edits
Recommend concrete fixes rather than general comments
anti_patterns: Requesting unnecessary experiments outside the scope

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude and Codex?
faq.answer: Yes. It is a text based workflow usable in Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: It cannot verify raw data, run analyses, or check external repositories.

faq.question: Can it integrate with a journal workflow?
faq.answer: Yes. Use it to draft review sections that you copy into the journal system.

faq.question: Does it access my files or credentials?
faq.answer: No. The content is instructional and does not request sensitive data.

faq.question: What if the review feels too generic?
faq.answer: Provide more manuscript details and specify the study type and discipline.

faq.question: How does it compare to a checklist only?
faq.answer: It combines checklists with structured commentary and prioritization guidance.
